section.name: Create STAR mapper index module
section.p: This module allow to create a STAR mapper index with custom options. If this module is not declared in the workflow file, the default mapper index generator will be used if you want to use STAR as mapper.

ul.li: Available: Both local and distributed mode

Input ports:
genome: genome sequence file (format: genome_fasta)
genomedescription: genome description (automatically generated from genome sequence file)
annotation: genome annotation in GFF3 or GTF format (if required in parameters)

Output port:
output: genome mapper index

tr.td: Specifies the length of the genomic sequence around the annotated junction to be used in constructing the splice junctions database

If true, the GFF3 annotation specified in the design file will be used by STAR to extract splice junctions. Using this option greatly improve the accuracy of the mapping. It is highly recommanded to use this option when feature annotation is available.
Path to the file that contains the list of splice junctions coordinates
Feature type (3rd column in GFF file) to be used
GFF attribute to be used as feature ID
The features file format. Currently only GFF/GFF3 and GTF format are supported.
See STAR documentation for more information
See STAR documentation for more information
Use the genomictype and attributeid parameters values from an expression step to set the values of the gtf.feature.exon and gtf.tag.exon.parent.transcript parameters of this step
